required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Evaluations of Ketohexokinase Isoforms in Endometrial Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Our preliminary analysis with clinical database suggested that, in patients with type I endometrial cancer, high ketohexokinase-expressing group have lower survival probabilities than low ketohexokinase-expressing group. To understand the importance of ketohexokinase expression and isoform switch during the development of type I endometrial cancer, we propose a series of in vitro experiments and clinical examinations in this project.

primary_outcome.measure: The role of ketohexokinase isoforms in the overall survival of endometrial cancer.
primary_outcome.description: Cox proportional hazard regression to evaluate the role of ketohexokinase isoforms in the overall survival of endometrial cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of ketohexokinase isoforms with the other prognostic risk factors
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of ketohexokinase isoforms with deep myometrial invasion, tumor grade, lymph node metastasis, FIGO stage, tumor size, progression-free survival, etc.

intervention.description: Check the isoforms of ketohexokinase in the specimen of endometrial cancer

study_pop.textblock: Women with endometrial cancer who underwent staging surgeries in the Far Eastern Memorial Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >20 years
- Women with endometrial cancer who are about to be admitted to hospital for gynecological staging.
- Women who have undergone gynecological staging surgery for endometrial cancer in the past.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with endometrial cancer who receive preoperative chemotherapy or radiation therapy.

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Far-Eastern Memorial Hospital
